alert.note: Alert for East Central Plains; Middle Rio Grande Valley; Northeast Highlands; Northeast Plains; Sandia Manzano And Gallinas Mountains; West Central Highlands (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued March 03 at 5:38AM MST until March 04 at 8:00PM MST by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH FRIDAY LATE MORNING THROUGH EARLY EVENING ACROSS THE WEST CENTRAL HIGHLANDS, MIDDLE RIO GRANDE VALLEY, NORTHEAST HIGHLANDS, SANDIA/MANZANO AND GALLINAS MOUNTAINS, AND EASTERN PLAINS BELOW SIGNIFICANT SNOWPACK DUE TO STRONG WIND AND LOW HUMIDITY... .An upper level disturbance will bring strong southwest winds aloft into New Mexico on Friday. Through the afternoon, these strong winds will mix down to the surface with gusty conditions expected over much of southwestern, central and eastern New Mexico. In addition, above average warmth will remain in place with dry conditions, low humidity and an unstable atmosphere. This will lead to several hours of critical fire weather. ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY MORNING THROUGH FRIDAY EVENING... * AREA AND TIMING...West Central Highlands, Middle Rio Grande Valley, Northeast Highlands, Sandia/Manzano and Gallinas Mountains, and Eastern Plains below significant snowpack Friday from late morning through early evening. The most critical conditions will occur during mid to late afternoon, when winds will be the strongest. * 20 FOOT WINDS...Southwest 20 to 30 mph with occasional gusts of 40 to 50 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...Dropping between 9 to 15 percent. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Fire Weather Watch.

area.areaDesc: East Central Plains; Middle Rio Grande Valley; Northeast Highlands; Northeast Plains; Sandia Manzano And Gallinas Mountains; West Central Highlands
